Indicates whether LIMIT has to be updated when the Amendment is authorized, but prior to use of Operation D in Letter of Credit. Input of value Yes creates a second limit line, after authorization, if there is an upward impact on the LIABILITY, which could happen by way of increase of INC.DEC.AMOUNT or increase of tolerance in INC.CR.AMOUNT.

This is done by creating a second limit line, when the value YES is entered. It carries the Amendment reference. However, the user has the option to define 'YES' or 'NO' for each of the Amendment. When the value is NO, there is no second limit line, but the limit effect is carried out only when the Operation D is chosen in Letter of Credit and the AMEND.STATUS is APPROVED.

This value however defaults with YES when the INC.DEC.AMOUNT is input with a positive value. The Letter of Credit, does not move to history, unless a decision on all the authorized Amendments is taken.
'YES' or 'NO'.

Used to define the percentage to be added to the Letter of Credit amount (LC.AMOUNT) to calculate the LIABILITY.AMOUNT.
A rate is specified here, which is used to calculate the LIABILITY.AMOUNT of the Letter of Credit by adding this percentage to the LC.AMOUNT.
Example: If the LC.AMOUNT = 1,000,000.00 and the percentage entered here = 10, then the LIABILITY.AMOUNT will be equal to 1,100,000.00.
The value input in this field replaces PERCENTAGE.CR.AMT in Letter of Credit on approval of Amendment.
(1) Standard rate format (Only up to 6 integer and decimal characters).
(2) If this Field is entered, then MAXIMUM.CR.AMT must be left blank.
(3) Holds positive values only.

CHARGE.STATUS
Code to identify the required status of the Commission/Charge, whether it is to be collected immediately or deferred or waived.

When the status is NULL, the Commission/Charge amount will be calculated and written in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES. No accounting will take place. This has to be collected later using Operation C in LC, at which time Tax if any will also be collected.
If the status is 2, Commission/Charge will be collected immediately along with Tax if any.
If the status is 15, the charge is waived and cannot be collected in the future. If is stored in LC.ACCOUNT.BALANCES as a charge that has been waived.
Valid input NULL or 2.

This field is for Sender to Receiver (i.e. Sending bank to Receiving bank) Information. Any information entered into this field will appear on a S.W.I.F.T. MT202 message (General Financial Institution Transfer).
It may be used to provide instructions or additional information for the Receiver, Intermediary, Account with Institution or Beneficiary Institution.
This field corresponds to field 72 on S.W.I.F.T. messages, and must never be used for information for which another field is intended, or for instructions not required in a message.
Up to 35 characters (uppercase alpha or numeric) - type SW Multivalue field. A maximum of 6 lines of 35 characters each will be allowed. (Optional input)
If this field is used, the first multivalue must contain a codeword followed by further information.

All code words must be valid code words as defined in S.W.I.F.T. documentation and must conform to the rules specified. Use of invalid code words will cause a message rejection when validated by S.W.I.F.T.
Further code words and information can be entered in subsequent multivalues, but additional information continued on a new line must be preceded by a double slash '//'

This field enables the user to divert a particular message type to another (third) party.
The user has a number of options:
Simple insertion of a name or address. This will re-route the message in PRINT format to the named party.
The code 'TX-' followed by a telex number. This will re-route the message by TELEX to the number detailed.
The code 'SW-' followed by a SWIFT. code. This will re-route the message by SWIFT to the respective bank.
The code 'C-' followed by a valid customer number or mnemonic. This will re-route the message in PRINT format to the customer indiated.
